title: Freshdesk's Online User Guide
text: If you can't find the answer you're looking for in this KB, you can try Freshdesk's own user guide, but note that due to the configuration and customisations we have done for K3, not everything will look and work the same Freshdesk Agent Guide : Freshdesk
description:
If you can't find the answer you're looking for in this KB, you can try Freshdesk's own user guide, but note that due to the configuration and customisations we have done for K3, not everything will look and work the same


Freshdesk Agent Guide : Freshdesk

title: Draft ticket responses - saved for 24 hours!
text: If you draft a response or note in a ticket, but don't finish/send it, the draft will remain there for 24 hours (so next time you enter the ticket, if it's within 24 hours of the last time you were in it creating a draft, the same draft will still be there).
description: If you draft a response or note in a ticket, but don't finish/send it, the draft will remain there for 24 hours (so next time you enter the ticket, if it's within 24 hours of the last time you were in it creating a draft, the same draft will still be there).

title: How/when to merge duplicate contacts
text: An example scenario is when someone calling already has a contact in Freshdesk, but their phone number is not stored against the contact, a second contact might be created with the unknown phone number, so in this case you would merge contacts.
description: An example scenario is when someone calling already has a contact in Freshdesk, but their phone number is not stored against the contact, a second contact might be created with the unknown phone number, so in this case you would merge contacts.

title: What email notifications are sent to customers?
text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Ticket Updates CSAT Manually Requesting CSAT Ticket Updates Customers receive the following email notifications automatically: New ticket created UNLESS the ticket source is Phone and the ticket is created with a Status of Resolved or Closed (i.e. solved at first contact on the phone, so no need to email new ticket details, but they will receive a resolved email if the conditions below are met) Every time a support agent add a comment to a ticket Every time a ticket is resolved by a support agent CSAT When resolving a ticket, a request for customer satisfaction (CSAT) feedback is also sent if the following criteria are fulfilled (there is a copy of this rule for each language - the below is the catch-all for English language CSAT to be sent) Manually Requesting CSAT You can manually request CSAT (if you want to request it when the rules above means that it's not sent automatically), by clicking the CSAT icon as shown below: Once you've clicked the button, you'll see this The CSAT request will be appended to the bottom of the email: Also see Copy / CC Notifications
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Ticket Updates
  • CSAT
    • Manually Requesting CSAT


Ticket Updates

Customers receive the following email notifications automatically:

  • New ticket created UNLESS the ticket source is Phone and the ticket is created with a Status of Resolved or Closed (i.e. solved at first contact on the phone, so no need to email new ticket details, but they will receive a resolved email if the conditions below are met)
  • Every time a support agent add a comment to a ticket
  • Every time a ticket is resolved by a support agent


CSAT

When resolving a ticket, a request for customer satisfaction (CSAT) feedback is also sent if the following criteria are fulfilled (there is a copy of this rule for each language - the below is the catch-all for English language CSAT to be sent)



Manually Requesting CSAT

You can manually request CSAT (if you want to request it when the rules above means that it's not sent automatically), by clicking the CSAT icon as shown below:




Once you've clicked the button, you'll see this


The CSAT request will be appended to the bottom of the email:


Also see Copy / CC Notifications

title: Copy / CC Notifications
text: The CC Notification is only sent to anyone where the requester has added a copy person on the portal. It is NOT sent if the ticket arrived by email and people were copied on the email.
description: The CC Notification is only sent to anyone where the requester has added a copy person on the portal. It is NOT sent if the ticket arrived by email and people were copied on the email.

title: File attachment size limit
text: There is a 25mb limit per attachment (FreshDesk increased this for us on 29th March 2023 from the standard 20mb limit. The limit is not per ticket, it is per attachment
description:
There is a 25mb limit per attachment (FreshDesk increased this for us on 29th March 2023 from the standard 20mb limit. 


The limit is not per ticket, it is per attachment

title: Reply or Add Public Note?
text: If you click the Reply button in a ticket, it will send an email including an email chain of all previous replies and public comments. Adding a Public Note will just send an email to the contact with that note only in it with subject something like "K3CS385 Ticket Updated - add promotion button to my till" Using Reply is normally best, but if the email chain is getting very long or includes information which is not relevant etc, you may wish to add public Note instead of using Reply
description:
If you click the Reply button in a ticket, it will send an email including an email chain of all previous replies and public comments.


Adding a Public Note will just send an email to the contact with that note only in it with subject something like "K3CS385 Ticket Updated - add promotion button to my till"



Using Reply is normally best, but if the email chain is getting very long or includes information which is not relevant etc, you may wish to add public Note instead of using Reply

title: Ticket number format and how to search for a ticket number
text: The ticket number / reference is actually just a number like 1234 in FD, but some views within FD show a # in front of the number like #1234 and all emails to customers are configured to put the prefix "K3CS" in front of it like "K3CS1234" which gives the number more meaning and also might be used in future to differentiate Customer Success tickets from any other department using FD. When searching for a ticket, simply enter the number into the search bar to find it (you can restrict the search to just Tickets if you want as well). Entering a # in front of the number or "K3CS" in front of it will not find it!
description:
The ticket number / reference is actually just a number like 1234 in FD, but some views within FD show a # in front of the number like #1234 and all emails to customers are configured to put the prefix "K3CS" in front of it like "K3CS1234" which gives the number more meaning and also might be used in future to differentiate Customer Success tickets from any other department using FD.


When searching for a ticket, simply enter the number into the search bar to find it (you can restrict the search to just Tickets if you want as well). Entering a # in front of the number or "K3CS" in front of it will not find it!

title: Where is the company name on a ticket?
text: The company name is on the right hand panel on a ticket as shown below. If it's missing, then you need to edit the contact to associate a company as per How to Associate a Company
description: The company name is on the right hand panel on a ticket as shown below. If it's missing, then you need to edit the contact to associate a company as per How to Associate a Company

title: Why can't I raise a ticket by selecting the company first?
text: Freshdesk is designed to always start from a contact, then look up the company, site, contract etc. There is nothing we can do to change this. You can of course look up a company and see all their contacts before adding a ticket
description: Freshdesk is designed to always start from a contact, then look up the company, site, contract etc. There is nothing we can do to change this. You can of course look up a company and see all their contacts before adding a ticket

title: Orders in CRM
text: In future we may have an integration, but for now, anything you would have added an Order for in CRM before Freshdesk went live, still needs to be entered into CRM (or passed to the CSM to get them to enter it!). Therefore, for Denmark, the articles in the OneNote global processes Order, Planning, Pricing Denmark (Web view) still apply
description:
In future we may have an integration, but for now, anything you would have added an Order for in CRM before Freshdesk went live, still needs to be entered into CRM (or passed to the CSM to get them to enter it!).


Therefore, for Denmark, the articles in the OneNote global processes Order, Planning, Pricing Denmark  (Web view) still apply

title: Canned Responses
text: Canned responses are a way to quickly insert content into a ticket reply for frequently used phrases or updates without having to type anything. This might be something like requesting a log file and giving the customer a path or screenshot of where to find it. See more at Using Canned Responses in ticket replies : Freshdesk Support agents can create their own canned responses, but they will only be visible to them. It's much better to have canned responses which are used by multiple agents so that a consistent message is sent to customers from all agents. If you want to request a canned response, please add an entry to Freshdesk Support Team Feedback
description:
Canned responses are a way to quickly insert content into a ticket reply for frequently used phrases or updates without having to type anything. This might be something like requesting a log file and giving the customer a path or screenshot of where to find it. See more at Using Canned Responses in ticket replies : Freshdesk 


Support agents can create their own canned responses, but they will only be visible to them. It's much better to have canned responses which are used by multiple agents so that a consistent message is sent to customers from all agents.


If you want to request a canned response, please add an entry to Freshdesk Support Team Feedback

title: Freshdesk Arcade (Leaderboard)
text: What is it? Freshdesk Arcade allows agents to gather points for resolving tickets, getting positive feedback, and ensuring the customer has a good experience. Points & Levels Points Points are awarded to agents based on how fast they resolve the tickets assigned to them. There are also bonus points for first-call resolution and satisfied customers. Agents can also lose points for late resolution of tickets and for unhappy customers. This is how the points are currently allocated. Agent Levels An agent can reach higher achievement levels as they gain more points. Trophies & Quests Trophies The points awarded are added towards trophies that can be viewed from within the dashboards. Trophies are based on different criteria and an agent can receive one of 4 trophies. Quests Quests represent performance goals that are set for agents, for completing them they will be awarded badges of honour and additional point bonus.
description:
What is it?

Freshdesk Arcade allows agents to gather points for resolving tickets, getting positive feedback, and ensuring the customer has a good experience.

 

Points & Levels


Points

Points are awarded to agents based on how fast they resolve the tickets assigned to them. There are also bonus points for first-call resolution and satisfied customers. Agents can also lose points for late resolution of tickets and for unhappy customers. 

This is how the points are currently allocated. 


Agent Levels

An agent can reach higher achievement levels as they gain more points. 

 

Trophies & Quests


Trophies

The points awarded are added towards trophies that can be viewed from within the dashboards.

Trophies are based on different criteria and an agent can receive one of 4 trophies.


 

Quests


Quests represent performance goals that are set for agents, for completing them they will be awarded badges of honour and additional point bonus.

title: Report data out of sync with ticket view
text: This might happen because report data is only refreshed every 30 mins as per What is the refresh time for the data in Analytics? : Freshdesk
description: This might happen because report data is only refreshed every 30 mins as per What is the refresh time for the data in Analytics? : Freshdesk

title: Quick access to your most used views
text: Start by rightclicking on the bookmarks bar. From here, choose "Add folder", for convenience you could name it "My views" Now go to the views you would like to access quickly. A good one would be 0a. "My Open Tickets" Copy the link of the view and paste it onto the folder Now you can simply right click on the folder, and click "Open all". If you wanna be even faster, do a "middle mouse click" on the folder, pressing down on the mouse wheel itself, to open up all links in the folder at once.
description:
Start by rightclicking on the bookmarks bar. From here, choose "Add folder", for convenience you could name it "My views"


Now go to the views you would like to access quickly. A good one would be 0a. "My Open Tickets"



Copy the link of the view and paste it onto the folder


Now you can simply right click on the folder, and click "Open all". If you wanna be even faster, do a "middle mouse click" on the folder, pressing down on the mouse wheel itself, to open up all links in the folder at once.

title: Bulk Update Tickets
text: This is the general way of doing a bulk update. There is an alternative for Tracker tickets - see Bulk updating tickets linked to a tracker You can bulk update tickets by selecting all tickets after you've filtered a ticket view to show only the tickets you want to update. Click the box shown below to select all (or select individual tickets if you don't want to update them all), and then the buttons appear as shown below Once you've clicked Bulk Update, the panel on the right changes to show you everything you can update. This only works for the results you see on the page, so if your ticket list you want to change goes to multiple pages, you'll need to this for each page. TREAT THIS WITH EXTREME CAUTION - MAKE SURE YOU'VE CAREFULLY THOUGHT THROUGH WHAT THE CONSEQUENCES ARE OF MAKING THE SAME UPDATE(S) TO EVERY TICKET !
description:
This is the general way of doing a bulk update. There is an alternative for Tracker tickets - see Bulk updating tickets linked to a tracker


You can bulk update tickets by selecting all tickets after you've filtered a ticket view to show only the tickets you want to update. Click the box shown below to select all (or select individual tickets if you don't want to update them all), and then the buttons appear as shown below




Once you've clicked Bulk Update, the panel on the right changes to show you everything you can update.


This only works for the results you see on the page, so if your ticket list you want to change goes to multiple pages, you'll need to this for each page.


TREAT THIS WITH EXTREME CAUTION - MAKE SURE YOU'VE CAREFULLY THOUGHT THROUGH WHAT THE CONSEQUENCES ARE OF MAKING THE SAME UPDATE(S) TO EVERY TICKET !

title: Useful Reports for Support Agents / Analysts
text: The following are useful reports that have been created for support analysts in the Retail Solutions BU. This should help to make sure that tickets don't fall through the gaps, and help identify any areas you need to work on. Report Name/Link Purpose Assigned Tickets Needing Attention In different tabs, shows all YOUR tickets which need attention but which is not easily captured in ticket views: Have not been updated for a long time Had negative feedback in the last 2 weeks This report is included in the Weekly tasks / checklist Team Objectives 2024 H1 Monitor performance against formal objectives Solutions Knowledge Base Analysis KB tab on Objectives report has a summary, but this report goes into more detail about what's being created and used Agent Ticket Performance Report More explanation of column meanings on Agent Performance Report in Analytics : Freshdesk Retail Solutions Weekly Ops Meeting Overview of current status and trends which is how the Retail Solutions management team assess how Support are doing CSAT Analysis Filter down to your team or yourself to see how your customer satisfactions ratings are doing Selected Customer Tickets Useful if you are having a general meeting with a customer
description:
The following are useful reports that have been created for support analysts in the Retail Solutions BU. This should help to make sure that tickets don't fall through the gaps, and help identify any areas you need to work on.


Report Name/Link
Purpose
Assigned Tickets Needing AttentionIn different tabs, shows all YOUR tickets which need attention but which is not easily captured in ticket views:
  • Have not been updated for a long time
  • Had negative feedback in the last 2 weeks

This report is included in the Weekly tasks / checklist 

Team Objectives 2024 H1Monitor performance against formal objectives
Solutions Knowledge Base AnalysisKB tab on Objectives report has a summary, but this report goes into more detail about what's being created and used
Agent Ticket Performance ReportMore explanation of column meanings on Agent Performance Report in Analytics : Freshdesk
Retail Solutions Weekly Ops Meeting
Overview of current status and trends which is how the Retail Solutions management team assess how Support are doing
CSAT Analysis
Filter down to your team or yourself to see how your customer satisfactions ratings are doing
Selected Customer Tickets
Useful if you are having a general meeting with a customer

title: Re-send activation emails
text: Customer Usually complains that they cannot reset their password or get into their account. The below shows why in an instance If the contact has this exclamation mark over it when you hover over the name it means that their contact is not verified and needs sending. Simply send the activation email and they can set their password and get into their account.
description:
Customer Usually complains that they cannot reset their password or get into their account. 


The below shows why in an instance


If the contact has this exclamation mark over it when you hover over the name it means that their contact is not verified and needs sending.  





Simply send the activation email and they can set their password and get into their account.

title: Teams Integration
text: An integration between Freshdesk and Teams allows alerts to be sent automatically from Freshdesk to Teams. There is an app each agent can install if they wish, and an automation for P1 portal tickets as described below TABLE OF CONTENTS Freshdesk / Teams app How to Install It How/Why Use It? P1 tickets from the portal Freshdesk / Teams app How to Install It Full instructions can be found on The Microsoft Teams App : Freshdesk , but that includes a lot of info for Administrators, so quite simply: From the left panel, click on Apps and search for Freshdesk. Click Add. How/Why Use It? You can use it to be alerted in Teams to updates on tickets you're watching in Freshdesk. You can install it to see how it works and if its useful for you, or just ignore it! Ive documented the Freshdesk app and how to install here. Below is an example of what you can get (including clickable link to the ticket) is shown below (after clicking on the Freshdesk app which appears on Teams chat like a person or any other chat would. P1 tickets from the portal We should be aware as soon as a P1 from the portal is created. Its not possible to create a P1 from email without one of us updating the ticket, and by definition, all P1s from phone are known about by one of us already, hence only posting about P1s from the portal The integration only allows posting to a public Channel, but I know that most people dont monitor posts in the channels very much, and new messages in Chats are much easier to see. So the mechanism is that Freshdesk posts to the relevant channel in the Support team as shown below (this is just for information, you dont need to monitor the channel) We have a Teams Workflow which detects posts to the P1 channels, and posts a link to them in the relevant normal country chat as shown in the example below for a UK P1 which happened this afternoon while I was configuring this Clicking on Click here to see more details in the chat post takes you to the Channel post which then has some basic information, and a clickable link to the ticket in Freshdesk The chats being posted to (as applicable) are DK Support chat, UK Support Chat, Waalwijk - Daily Support Chat, and P1 Teams Chat Germany. When you see the post, as per the instructions in orange in the example above, someone from First Line (or Second Line if First Line not available) should like the post in the chat so that we know someone (and who) is responding.
description:
An integration between Freshdesk and Teams allows alerts to be sent automatically from Freshdesk to Teams. There is an app each agent can install if they wish, and an automation for P1 portal tickets as described below


TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Freshdesk / Teams app 
    • How to Install It
    • How/Why Use It?
  • P1 tickets from the portal



Freshdesk / Teams app 

How to Install It

Full instructions can be found on The Microsoft Teams App : Freshdesk , but that includes a lot of info for Administrators, so quite simply:


  1. From the left panel, click on Apps and search for Freshdesk.

  2. Click Add. 


How/Why Use It?

  1. You can use it to be alerted in Teams to updates on tickets you're watching in Freshdesk.
  2. You can install it to see how it works and if its useful for you, or just ignore it! Ive documented the Freshdesk app and how to install here.
  3. Below is an example of what you can get (including clickable link to the ticket) is shown below (after clicking on the Freshdesk app which appears on Teams chat like a person or any other chat would.
     

 


P1 tickets from the portal

  1. We should be aware as soon as a P1 from the portal is created. Its not possible to create a P1 from email without one of us updating the ticket, and by definition, all P1s from phone are known about by one of us already, hence only posting about P1s from the portal
  2. The integration only allows posting to a public Channel, but I know that most people dont monitor posts in the channels very much, and new messages in Chats are much easier to see.
  1. So the mechanism is that Freshdesk posts to the relevant channel in the Support team as shown below (this is just for information, you dont need to monitor the channel)
     
  2. We have a Teams Workflow which detects posts to the P1 channels, and posts a link to them in the relevant normal country chat as shown in the example below for a UK P1 which happened this afternoon while I was configuring this
     
    Clicking on Click here to see more details in the chat post takes you to the Channel post which then has some basic information, and a clickable link to the ticket in Freshdesk
     

     
    1. The chats being posted to (as applicable) are DK Support chat, UK Support Chat, Waalwijk - Daily Support Chat, and P1 Teams Chat Germany.
    2. When you see the post, as per the instructions in orange in the example above, someone from First Line (or Second Line if First Line not available) should like the post in the chat so that we know someone (and who) is responding.

title: Automated emails do not stop the First Response timer
text: The First Response Timer is only stopped when an agent makes a response. So, for example, if you review a ticket and decide it needs to go to Development, when you set the ticket to "Waiting for Development", it will send the customer an automated email telling them this, but that will not stop the First Response Timer. The best thing to do (always!) is to tell the customer when you start investigating, that you are investigating the ticket (which will stop the First Response Timer).
description:
The First Response Timer is only stopped when an agent makes a response. So, for example, if you review a ticket and decide it needs to go to Development, when you set the ticket to "Waiting for Development", it will send the customer an automated email telling them this, but that will not stop the First Response Timer.


The best thing to do (always!) is to tell the customer when you start investigating, that you are investigating the ticket (which will stop the First Response Timer).

title: Analytics Reports do NOT include merged tickets
text: Merged tickets are tagged with "Merged" but will not appear in Analytics reports even though they can be found when doing a ticket search
description: Merged tickets are tagged with "Merged" but will not appear in Analytics reports even though they can be found when doing a ticket search

title: Re-Assign Primary Ticket After Merging Tickets
text: If you have merged multiple tickets, and you have accidentally made the incorrect ticket as the primary ticket, you can change the primary ticket by finding the ticket that was merged into the current primary ticket, go to merge the ticket again, and find the primary ticket by ticket ID, remove the link, then re-add the link and make the correct ticket the primary ticket.
description: If you have merged multiple tickets, and you have accidentally made the incorrect ticket as the primary ticket, you can change the primary ticket by finding the ticket that was merged into the current primary ticket, go to merge the ticket again, and find the primary ticket by ticket ID, remove the link, then re-add the link and make the correct ticket the primary ticket.
